column2: IOWA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column6: IA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: parking lights.

column2: 2. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column6: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.
column8: get to your destination much faster.

column2: 3. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 4. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: a yield sign.
column10: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 5. Regulatory signs are:
column6: Warnings

column2: 6. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 7. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 8. Braking distance is affected by:
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 9. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: signal other vehicles to stop.
column10: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 10. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Warning signs

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 12. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: green; white

column2: 13. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 14. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Drinking coffee.
column8: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 15. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.
column6: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column8: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: the road may be slippery when wet.
column6: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 17. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
column6: stay off the brakes.

column2: 18. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when it is hard to see ahead.
column8: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 19. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column10: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 20. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column6: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column10: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 21. This sign, displayed on the rear of a vehicle, indicates that:
column4: the vehicle is being drawn by an animal.
column6: the vehicle is traveling 25 MPH or less.

column2: 22. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column6: 10 minutes.

column2: 23. In speed zones of 45 MPH or less, you must signal your turn continuously during the last ______feet before turning.
column6: 250 feet

column2: 24. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Take a cold shower before driving.

column2: 25. According to the Iowa Implied Consent Law for both resident and non-resident drivers:
column4: an arrested driver may be asked to submit to a chemical test to determine the alcohol content in their blood.
column6: refusal to submit to chemical testing will result in the driving privileges being withdrawn.

column2: 26. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column6: Right lane closed
column10: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 28. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column6: a stop sign.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column6: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road

column2: 30. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column6: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column8: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column10: speed up to beat the train.

column2: 31. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column6: must not yield to

column2: 32. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column6: Experienced drivers.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 33. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
column6: stay in the right lane as much as possible.
column8: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
column10: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.

column2: 34. This sign means:
column6: The road will curve to the right.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 35. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
